      Allows Derivative classes to handle the XML Attrs without creating a TypedArray themsevles
      protected boolean isReadyForPullEnd()
      Implemented by derived class to return whether the View is in a state where the user can Pull to Refresh by scrolling from the end.
      protected boolean isReadyForPullStart()
      Implemented by derived class to return whether the View is in a state where the user can Pull to Refresh by scrolling from the start.
      protected void onPullToRefresh()
      Called when the UI has been to be updated to be in the PullToRefreshBase.State.PULL_TO_REFRESH state.
      protected void onRefreshing(boolean doScroll)
      Called when the UI has been to be updated to be in the PullToRefreshBase.State.REFRESHING or PullToRefreshBase.State.MANUAL_REFRESHING state.
      protected void onReleaseToRefresh()
      Called when the UI has been to be updated to be in the PullToRefreshBase.State.RELEASE_TO_REFRESH state.
      protected void onReset()
      Called when the UI has been to be updated to be in the PullToRefreshBase.State.RESET state.

    • Method Detail

      • getShowIndicator

        public boolean getShowIndicator()
        Gets whether an indicator graphic should be displayed when the View is in a state where a Pull-to-Refresh can happen. An example of this state is when the Adapter View is scrolled to the top and the mode is set to Mode#PULL_FROM_START. The default value is true if isPullToRefreshOverScrollEnabled() returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the indicators will be shown

      • onScroll

        public final void onScroll(android.widget.AbsListView view,

      • setAdapter

        public void setAdapter(android.widget.ListAdapter adapter)
        Pass-through method for getRefreshableView(). AdapterView.setAdapter(android.widget.Adapter) setAdapter(adapter)}. This is just for convenience!
        Parameters:
        adapter - - Adapter to set

      • setEmptyView

        public final void setEmptyView(android.view.View newEmptyView)
        Sets the Empty View to be used by the Adapter View.

        We need it handle it ourselves so that we can Pull-to-Refresh when the Empty View is shown.

        Please note, you do not usually need to call this method yourself. Calling setEmptyView on the AdapterView will automatically call this method and set everything up. This includes when the Android Framework automatically sets the Empty View based on it's ID.

        Parameters:
        newEmptyView - - Empty View to be used

      • setOnItemClickListener

        public void setOnItemClickListener(android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemClickListener listener)
        Pass-through method for getRefreshableView(). setOnItemClickListener(listener). This is just for convenience!
        Parameters:
        listener - - OnItemClickListener to use

      • setShowIndicator

        public void setShowIndicator(boolean showIndicator)
        Sets whether an indicator graphic should be displayed when the View is in a state where a Pull-to-Refresh can happen. An example of this state is when the Adapter View is scrolled to the top and the mode is set to Mode#PULL_FROM_START
        Parameters:
        showIndicator - - true if the indicators should be shown.

        handleStyledAttributes in class PullToRefreshBase<T extends android.widget.AbsListView>
        Parameters:
        a - - TypedArray of PullToRefresh Attributes

      • isReadyForPullStart

        protected boolean isReadyForPullStart()
        Description copied from class: PullToRefreshBase
        Implemented by derived class to return whether the View is in a state where the user can Pull to Refresh by scrolling from the start.
        Specified by:
        isReadyForPullStart in class PullToRefreshBase<T extends android.widget.AbsListView>
        Returns:
        true if the View is currently the correct state (for example, top of a ListView)

      • updateUIForMode

        protected void updateUIForMode()
        Description copied from class: PullToRefreshBase
        Updates the View State when the mode has been set. This does not do any checking that the mode is different to current state so always updates.
        Overrides:
        updateUIForMode in class PullToRefreshBase<T extends android.widget.AbsListView>
